q: Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. back-to-back 3-pointers that gave the Pistons the lead for good and sent them to a 107-102 victory over the Golden State Warriors on Thursday night.`` That really hurt my feelings, that tip,'' Rasheed Wallace said. You can't let that frustrate you. I missed two point-blank foul shots. I'm upset at myself about that. You can't let that one thing get you down. That's what we did, just dug deep and came up with some stops down the stretch. Rick Barnes Hamilton scored 24 points and Allen Iverson added 23 as the Pistons won for the second straight time to open their four-game road trip after losing their first two games with Allen Iverson . Allen Iverson said he did not mind sitting out the final minutes of a blowout victory instead of attempting to set a career high. Honestly, and I can't be any truer than this, all I wanted was for the Milwaukee Buck Bucks to be down one point once there were all zeroes on the board, he said. `` I would like to express my sincere gratitude and appreciation to commissioner Roger Goodell for allowing me to be readmitted to the National Football League,'' Michael Vick said in a statement released by his agent, Joel Segal. I fully understand that playing football in the NFL is a privilege, not a right, and I am truly thankful for the opportunity I have been given.`` As you can imagine, the last two years have given me time to re-evaluate my life, mature as an individual and fully understand the terrible mistakes I have made in the past and what type of life I must lead moving forward, he said. the second major resignation for Andy Coulson over his role at News of the World. Before stepping down as editor four years ago, he quickly rose up the ranks of Rupert Murdoch 's empire. He was often characterized as the' Essex boy made good' thanks to hard-nosed ambition, drive and more than an ounce of sheer ruthlessness, says the Guardian. U.S. Hillary Clinton Kirsten Gillibrand of New York sent a letter to lawmakers in her state Tuesday urging them to pass the marriage equality bill this year. Capitol Tonight reports on the letter, in which Kirsten Gillibrand wrote, Equal protection under the law has been a hallmark of the American legal, social and political system since the founding of the republic. In this instance, I believe that this principle must be extended to all of those in our state who seek the civil contract of marriage and the numerous legal rights, protections and benefits that only the status of marriage confers. The correspondence accompanied a lobby day in Albany sponsored by Marriage Equality New York, which drew around 300 participants, or more than double the number from last year. Advocates feel hopeful about the bill, which
